results.content: Very good course, despite it's a intermediate/advanced course. It's for those who want to improve habillities and understand the new libraries, such as vue and react.

results.content: Course was really great, fast and straightforward. I've learned exactly what I expected to learn. Audio was really bad tho, with occasional volume changes
results.content_html: Course was really great, fast and straightforward. I've learned exactly what I expected to learn. Audio was really bad tho, with occasional volume changes

results.content:
This course was exactly what I was looking for. I have been trying to learn modern Javascript libraries that use virtual DOM's like Vue and React. I was looking for a course that gave some insight on how that worked. This course did exactly that. The instructor walks through how virtual DOM's work and walks you through the process of building one like React. At the end you have a working virtual DOM manipulation library. He even shows you how to add JSX support to your library. If you ever wondered how virtual DOM works, this is a great course to get you started. 

Before you pay for this course:
The course has a lot going for it. It's insightful yet to the point. You'll finish it in no time; however, there are some prerequisites you might want to have coming to this course and that is the following:

1. A knowledge of ES6 and some ES7 Javascript as the course uses nothing but modern javascript syntax.

2. A basic to intermediate understanding of DOM manipulation as well as how to use the DOM API to create, append and remove dom nodes from the page and

3. A basic to intermediate knowledge of React js as he teaches you how to build a library like React.

All of these things are not required but I found them valuable to know coming to this course. If I hadn't known these three things, I would probably be very lost especially if I made mistakes and needed to debug the code on my own which at one point I did need to and there was no explanation for what was wrong.

Why only 4 stars?

Even though I definitely got my monies worth out of this course, my only gripe is that the audio quality was inconsistent. There were times that the audio was very quiet and times where it was very loud. The instructor does have an accent but it's manageable and he does speak slowly and clearly which was a huge plus. The pace was nice and easy and that was very much appreciated. 

This course get's a definite recommendation from me to anyone wanting to know more about the underlying code of some modern virtual DOM based libraries especially if you are a React developer.
